Class SceneController

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.swdesign.movienightplanner.controllers.SceneController
public class SceneController extends Object
Controller class for managing scene transitions in the application. This controller facilitates navigation between the search view, movie detail view, and profile view. It ensures proper initialization and updates of scene-specific controllers during transitions. Dependencies: - The class requires preloaded Scene objects for each view. - Controllers for the views are set as user data in their respective scenes.
Author:
Make, ChatGPT(Javadoc comments)

  • Constructor Details

    • SceneController

      public SceneController(javafx.stage.Stage stage, javafx.scene.Scene searchScene, javafx.scene.Scene profileScene, javafx.scene.Scene movieDetailScene) throws IOException
      Constructs a SceneController with the given stage and initial search scene.
      Parameters:
      stage - The primary stage where scenes will be displayed.
      searchScene - The initial search scene to display.
      profileScene - The profile scene for user data and settings.
      movieDetailScene - The movie detail scene for displaying movie information.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue loading FXML resources.

  • Method Details

    • switchToSearch

      public void switchToSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Switches the current scene to the search view.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by the user, such as a button click.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue switching scenes.

    • switchToMovieDetail

      public void switchToMovieDetail(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event, Movie movie) throws IOException
      Switches the current scene to the movie details view. If the movie details scene has not been loaded previously, it initializes and configures it.
      Parameters:
      event - The mouse event triggered when a movie is selected.
      movie - The movie object whose details are to be displayed.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue loading the movie details view.

    • switchToProfile

      public void switchToProfile(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Switches the current scene to the profile view. If the profile scene has not been loaded previously, it initializes and configures it.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by the user, such as a button click.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue loading the profile view.

    • getStage

      public javafx.stage.Stage getStage()
      Gets the current stage associated with the scene controller.
      Returns:
      The stage where scenes are displayed.

    • getSearchScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene getSearchScene()
      Gets the search scene.
      Returns:
      The search scene.

    • getMovieDetailScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene getMovieDetailScene()
      Gets the movie detail scene if it has been initialized.
      Returns:
      The movie detail scene or null if it has not been loaded yet.

    • getProfileScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene getProfileScene()
      Gets the profile scene if it has been initialized.
      Returns:
      The profile scene or null if it has not been loaded yet.
